title: President appoints 3-member commission to probe unrest in Sri Lanka
body_lines: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a three-member Presidential Commission to inquire into the incidents of arson, looting, injuries caused to individuals and damages to properties from March 31 to May 15, 2022.
The commission of inquiry is headed by Supreme Court Justice Buwaneka Aluvihare and also includes former Senior DIG S.M. Wickramasinghe and Additional Chief Assessor N.A.S. Wasantha Kumara.
They had received their letters of appointment from President Rajapaksa at the President’s House in Fort this evening (01).
